overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a detailed analytical approach focused on pattern recognition and practical heuristics due to data limitations. It carefully examines seasonality, identifies distinct daily patterns, and develops a forecasting strategy based on observed odd/even day variations. The solution prioritizes interpretability and simplicity given the small dataset.
common_data_patterns: Midnight value spikes on even days
Sharp drops at 8:00 on even days
Similar daytime patterns after 8:00 across days
key_insights: Identification of alternating odd/even day patterns based on date parity
Use of day-type averaging instead of full-series models due to limited data
Prioritization of observable patterns over complex statistical models when data is insufficient
Handling of timestamp continuity and forecasting horizon alignment
complexity_analysis: Highly detailed multi-step analysis combining data inspection, pattern recognition, and heuristic modeling. Balances statistical considerations with practical implementation constraints.
